reviews.review_msg: Like to put students on spot. Especially those primary or first language is other than English.

fAir prof! Got A without much effort bcuz avg for Midterms was 50% and she curves grades (gives "high C or low C+" to avg)Goes slowly in lectures, and is very helpful in office hours. Final exam had a Q on this website...looks like she wanted to make us critically think why the comments here cannot be used to accurately judge an instructor hehe

I hated this class. The midterms and the final are impossible. The only chance for getting some marks is participation because the tests are so difficult. It takes a certain person to be able to understand this material. Do not take this class as a GPA booster as it will probably plummet!

The miderms were extremely difficult and so will the final. Textbook is useless and studying off her notes won't help you for exams. Thank god this course is curved with midterm averages of 55% and 48%. Some people understand the material instantly but it can be quite challenging for others.

I don't think anyone was as frightened as myself to take a critical thinking course.  Philosophy and especially Math were not my thing.  Dr. Mac was so helpful and I ended up with an A+ (Not sure where people get the idea she doesn't give A's)I think with a lot more depth than I ever have and I am thankful I took the course with her last year!

really good prof, but a really difficult course. she explains material well, also prepares slides which are extremely helpful.  exmas are hard, with tricky questions; understanding of the material, and practice are important. my TA was really helpful as well(his blog has lots of examples and answers to assignments)

Dr. Mc does an excellent job of teaching VERY difficult material.  However, alot of students seem to blame her teaching ability for their poor marks.  HELLO!  This is why the course is curved--your grade reflects your RELATIVE performance amongst your peers.  Be prepared: the midterm and final were the two toughest exams I've ever taken.

You have to pay attention at the lectures and read through the textbook. The lectures is the basic concepts and the foundation. In fact, the lectures and the questions in the textbook are much easier than that in the exams; however, they are necessary. If you want to get a high scores, practise the execises by yourself.

this course is useless? well, it's not her fault.  Notes are great but MTs and final are freaking hard ..study more might not help coz the examples providered are too easy... u might not fail it coz its scaled but don't expect a good mark
MUST attend all tut to get a good mark.. MUST read & dun be afraid to question the TA... TA is ur hero in this class...

Exams were VERY tricky, period. Mid-term class average was 50%. Lecutres were easy to follow but they don't prepare you for exams. Dunno whats the point of those homework assignmnets because people always fail them, but luckly they only coumt for completion. Don't take the course unless its compulsory
No Comments

She is great professor but the midterms are not that easy. TA are hard markers and my TA didn't respond the email at all.  Other TA cannot help at email too.  But fortunately, Dr Mc answered my question fully in email than my sucks TA.  He didn't ever look at the student's email or even deleted them as well, what he said.  Even we complained to him

If you want to go on academic Probation then take this course. TA's and Profs dont seem to understand that Less than 60% in any course is practically a failing mark. The first midterm is designed to fail you and lower your self esteem so much that you fail your other courses as well. However she does provide comprehensive partial notes which help.
Dr Mc is a great prof. Those that complain about the "unclearness" of the questions are not taking to consideration that this is a "Critical Thinking" course.

MC hammer makes this class very confusing..... midterms and final exam is very unfair as this basing wasnt clear.. questions where asked wasnt clear at all! however she does respond to emails :) but overall class was a bummer and this class will lower ur GPA a lot kk

Just because this course is a little tricky, it doesn't mean that Dr Mc hasn't done her job well. The wordings of the midterm and finals SHOULD be confusing and hard.. after all, this is a critical thinking course..  she isn't trying to trick us or anything!
No Comments

Jill McIntosh is a great prof! She tries to make lectures as entertaining as possible. Her partial notes keep you engaged in the class so that you can keep up with what she's saying. Exams are really tricky though. Know your stuff really well or you won't have time to finish. You really need to think in this class (hence "Critical Thinking").
Her class is interesting
didn't like this class at all
No Comments
I didn't even buy the book, and still got in the top 5 in the class for the 2 midterms. It's an easy course if you can think logically.
Dr. Mc is a man! [laughter]

WARNING!!! Extremely hard class. Teacher seems nice and happy, but the course is very boring and hard to make sense. Notes are very good, assignments are easy, but midterms uses very tricky English. Overall, this is NOT a GPA booster, do not take this course if you are on the merge of getting probated.

This class sounded very appealing before i took it but really the lectures and tutorials are extremely tedious and boring. You'll have to know how to study for urself considering a class average of 50% on the first midterm. The prof seems like an interesting person but she just doesn't bring that to the lectures.
easy on 1st midterms then hard for the rest; this is a self studied course; good if you are a fast thinker

i found this course quite easy. didn't read the textbook cause she gave us great notes. i studied off the notes which can be found online. they were straight forward and easy to understand. questions can be tricky but fair overall. TAs were good too. i enjoyed the course

Disturbingly easy course. I found the prof's explanations made things that I already understood more confusing if anything. Really boring, and she whined too much about kids talking at the beginning of class. Seems like a nice person though, and plays good music before class starts.

The course was actually quite okay. Midterms werent that hard. She is organized, and her notes were very helpful. I didnt even need to read the textbook. She is not bad, it is just that sometimes she might not sound that friendly.

Yes, the class was boring but I don't think that was necessarily the prof's fault. But, the class material was quite easy. I'd like to also point out that she mentioned this site on the final exam and I got the impression that she doesn't like it. After reading some of these posts I can see why.lol

STAY AWAY....STAY AWAY! DO NOT, I REPEAT, DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE. THIS COURSE WILL CAUSE YOUR GPA TO DROP. THE MATERIAL IS BORING AND EXTREEMLY POINTLESS. JILL MAKES BAD JOKES. SHE DOES SEND LECTURE NOTES PRIOR TO CLASS, BUT THE CLASS WILL STILL BE YOUR WORST NIGHTMARE. WANT PROOF? ASK ANYONE!

avoid taking this class first thing in the morning or you will end up sleeping in it or through it.  dr.mc was pretty fair about test material but watch out cuz mult.choice is tricky! also, she was very approachable and open to suggestions and even emailed out partial notes before every class.
She's great.
she's a great prof

phil 001, there is no way that i can say this is an easy course. so, taking this course as ur elective is not a good idea. (This was the one required in my case) Her exams are just so fair and her lecture and notes were clear. Not an easy course, but it's scaled. so it shouldn't be a problem!
worse teacher ever, hard mt and finals
Philosophy is scarred for me because of this prof. Never knew a course could be this hard, should have taken english intro fiction...ruined my gpa...

God..the class sucked, the final was impossible, went in with a B came out with a C in the end.  The TA's for this class are an absolute disgrace!! Took it as a breadth req for business, biggest mistake ever.  Dont take this unless you have the last registration appt and nothings available!
nice prof. easy midterms, the final is a little harder tho. Clear notes, lectures are fine...^^

She gives basic concepts and hopes first year students will be able to apply concepts on an advanced level test.  Good job of simplifying text book concepts but sometimes can make them too confusing, however, if you're good at real logic and actually thinking - course will be easy. Not recommended.
I think she's fair, what i dont like is the TWISTED MULTIPLE CHOICE PART. Damn, we get 0 even if we miss one? wtf? midterms are reasonable but final sucks, too many damn twisted MC and hard too...

she has good notes, but goes through them too fast.   had a hard time copying all of them, but she posts them on the web too. i just needed to read the notes to do the exams, good prof. the homework was only marked on completion.

Her lectures cover only very simple examples, yet she gives very complex problems to solve on an exam. This is a FORMAL LOGIC intro course - if you don't like logic, and aren't very good at math, don't take it. If P, then Q, If R, Then T. therefore P. If that doesn't make sense, don't take this cour
Her tests are fair and well written and her notes are extremely straight forward.  She was great!!!
it's my 2nd time taking it, and she's way easier then horban.  So for everyone who got screwed by horban, take 001 again with her.

DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE. It's hard to listen and take notes at the same time in this class since there are so many pages of notes from the overhead each class. There isn't enuff time to go check over things on midterms. Material may get confusing at times.

da prof iz fine tho, she explainz pretty well and nice, and her note iz so easy to review. However, since the subject it self is tricky, unless u study damn hard, it might not be a good class. But just rating the prof, i thinka she is kinda good..
Do not take phil 001. Avoid at ALL costs.
She is an awesome Prof. Her notes were very clear and told you exactly what would be on the tests. I highly recommend her for any first year student! She is so helpful!
had him for my phil 001 summer 2000. he was very helpful. easy to understand.
He is caring and genuine, recommended!
i think that he is the best teacher. also, he has his own book, you can get a good mark if u work hard and ask him question if you have questions.
His lecture and structure are so clearly. IF you read clearly before class, follow his step, you can have a good grades. He is really patient and nice.
My favorite instructor! Hope I could take more classese from him. Super helpful and patient!   (  )
he is an awesome prof!

Lyle is a really responsible professor, he does everything he can to help students. If u pay attention to his lecture, no worry you will have a really good mark in his tests. He always has passion and tries to interested students. Anyway, I made a wise choice. Thanks Lyle.
YES
Good.
really clear concepts, nice. just concentrate in class so exams will be okay.
Best instructor ever. I love her.
Best instructor ever.
Nice.
Jennifer present clear lectures  using  vivid examples.
Make most course materials become almost common sense, not much study required
Very Irritating Teacher
he is not good at phiL001.. gotta c (001)but c+ for phiL120...
No Comments
No Comments

U dont really need to go to the lecture .But for me ,having his lecture is quite enjoyable . Anyway , remember to borrow the notes from ur friends from last semester .He gives the same notes and examples every semester .Collect as much sample exams as u can .Otherwise U wont know whats going on in exam~~:)

peter horban is a very good prof.. his nots are crystal clear, if u copy his notes u will get the material by just reading his notes. his tests are hard with the part of multi-multiple choices section on. but over all a very good prof to learn with

I do not like his style, copying notes all the time in lectures makes me knowing nothing in the lecture, so preview the text is pivotal. Anyway, this course itself is pretty straight foward, it is easy to get an A,my TA is really helpful. Thank you, Amenda!

kinda boring lectures, only cuz the course material is fairly straight forward. exams rely on trickyness but thats what critical thinking is, how not to get duped. so if you easily get lost in double negatives and confusing sentences, you may have problems with the exams.

1 of those prof that think they know lots. assume students r like him so teaches hard. tons of notes so prepare ur hands. examples are long and confusing. mt/final are btw hard and fair. read text n go to tutorials n u might do well. dont count on horban.

the course is easy if you actually listen to his lectures without falling asleep. Exams were actually quite easy, yet somehow the class scored a failing average. Midterms were 45-50 minutes so not enough time for you to think before writing your answer down at all. Take too much time for one question, you're screwed

The reason he is easy, is because all exams are scaled. All you have to do, is be better than half of your peers. He is a very clear, and concise prof, he teaches material quite well. Make sure you ask your friends for practice material, you must study lots for exams.
No Comments

Critical Thinking...Don't do it! EVIL CLASS....he has the voice of God...I was totally excited and pumped for Philosophy and after taking Critical Thinking with him I will never take another Phil...the exams are killer and the material itself was too abstract. ex. If A then B, If B then C, therefore if A then C. Seems simple but it gets worse!

Easy midterms (scored 100 on both) and a more challenging final. The class average, however, is quite low and Critical Thinking is the sort of course where you either get it or you don't. Dr.Horban is a good lecturer and I recommend taking courses with him. Two thumbs moderately high up!
This teacher will not listen to you if you argue with him.
Midterm is very hard. You need to dig into your notes and the textbook. If you really understand everything, espeically those in his lecture, then enjoy your mark.

listen carefully during class, and write down all notes as possible as you can, because everything in class may appear in midterms and the final. remember, everything, including all of the funny questions and exersices that he said you do not need to write down. They will be really helpful during your review.

The Course is hard!!! The teacher has a very nice voice but he is cocky, thinking that he knows too much and he is is a bit rude. Course is boring if you are not a reasonable and logical person. Better take another philosophy course.

well, it was a terrible experience for me.  I find this prof rilli rude and cocky! he is not bad, but not good either. PS. students who got A+ provide no information about Peter Horban, and keep in mind that it's a curving class.
This class ruined my GPA too!!!  Horrible midterms with a weird format.  Has you scribbling down notes during the entire lecture because he refuses to post his overheads on a website!
Very confusing, tests are really hard
I love his lecture voice, although it could put you to sleep at times. Midterms are tricky but as long as you know your stuff, then it's ok. Do the past midterms, they help a lot!
I got A+...u guys are idiots...
dun like this prof taht much... i agree... midterms are quite tricky..... and during lecture.. he tries to be funny, but he tells relaly lame jokes.. =.=
No Comments
exams are very tricky... the average is low... but sfu has curving... so the outcome grade would be okay... just do all the past exam... then u will survive
The hwk were a lot easier than his midterms

This has been the worst course that I've taken. He thinks he's funny telling his cheap jokes. When he is not. He's not helpfull and he's also rude. Some ppl find this course ez I didn't. it depends on the type of person you are NO LOGIC, very confuse! Low
Class average is less than 50%; extremely difficult exams. If you don't like taking mensa tests then DON'T take this class...you will regret it. This class ruined my GPA!
PHIL001 is extremely easy. He is a very clear and eloquent lecturer, and the notes are excellent.
oh..nono..it's not an ez course!!trust me..
Horban is excellent.  To some he may be hard, but I found the course extremely easy.  If you work at it and understand the concepts, the course is simple.  He is an outstanding teacher.

tough tough tough exams....midterms are brutually hard...don't be misled by the course #.  his exams are complex and they are too long as well. his notes are ok but still midterms are hard. nice person otherwise.
I took PHIL001 and PHIL120. He gave hard exams and he is not friendly. Never answer question after class just because it's not his office hours.

Let just get one thing straight...this guy is hard.  Everyone may put smiley faces and stuff but this guy's class average is a little lower than 50%.  His exams are extremely tricky.  He has basic notes and when it comes to the exam it is more complex.
He was a very good prof overall. His voice was clear, and lectures were presented well. His tests were a bit hard, especially for ppl who do not know their stuff =P
I love Peter Horban! The class isn't the easiest but he's got the coolest voice and is super clear with everything he says. He also does nifty hand gestures and wears interesting shirts...

where did u guys get those '+20 copies of past year exams'? I love his lectures and his voice, but his exam is soooooooooooooooo tricky. i've just finished my first midterm and i feel hopeless cause i only got 26 out of 36.
His exams are soooooo predictable as long as you have +2o copies of past exams.. Mark my word for it.. I got an A because of it.
Best prof I ever had in 5 years at SFU. 10/10

Crystal clear lecture voice, good notes and he sticks to them. Never changes his examples in the I-don't-know-how-many years he's been teaching 001, but nonetheless relatively easy course, other than the fact that he gives low marks. He does scale.

Excellent prof!  He speaks loud & clear!  His lectures are fun, informative and allows you to think further!  It's good that all his midterms are always from his notes, books, hw, and it's similar to past MTs.
Excellent teacher, exams are hard but it does make you study more

Great and funny prof. Make the lecture so much fun. Materials are easy to understand. But his midterms and Finals are REALLY TRICKY, can't call it hard... but TRICKY. Do more past exams will help to avoid his tricks!
an "always thinking" course.  the average is low but the course IS curved, yet it seems like he gives fewer As/Bs than other profs i've had. with each exam it seems to get a bit easier though.
Curveball exams, but GREAT prof.
Eh, not a bad teacher, very tough course though.

Peter Horban is definitely a good teacher, i like his style pretty much although i'v been skipping his class for almost the whole semester, haha, but i did pretty good on the past 2 midterms, and remember, his in-class notes r even more helpfulthanthetext

With notes that are very well organized and easy to understand, homework that are only marked based on submission, and reading materials that are straight forward. You wouldn't expect the midterm average to be slightly higher than 40%. A filtering course.
No Comments
001 is extremely straightforward.  The students who don't like Peter are the ones that don't understand the material.  His "trick questions" aren't really tricks if you actually understand them.

001 is one of the most challenging courses in university, but Horban is the clearest lecturer you'll ever have. exams require you to *apply* taught material rather than merely write out defs. worth it - you'll come out a much clearer thinker & writer

It seems that his ultimate goal is to confuse students, and except for the few not-so-funny jokes in class, the lecture is pretty much dead... I guess u can't put all the blame on him, the course material is so freakin' boring.
he doesn't know how to teach
Great course, great guy, likes to listen to his own voice though (or at least he talks like it)
Peter Horban writes extremely organized and simple notes, and the assignments are easy. He has a lovely voice, and is adorable as well.
we love horban
Ruined my life at SFU.  Heck my life was ruined when I stepped into SFU.

Definitely an interesting course if you are into logic and all that. Although a lot of people found his exams to be tricky, I felt they were actually pretty easy. The prof is the best part of the course. Funny and very resourceful.
his exams are tough (average of 50 or usually lower)
His tests are tricky, but otherwise a fine professor.
funny gesture.. talks little too fast......very sleepy class.......

Horban's lectures are very clear, and you can always expected to be treated/graded fairly. PHIL 001 is a useful (if dry) course that helps to dicipline your thinking - I highly recommend it to students in their first semester, especially those in Arts.
Super awsome prof

Easy course if u really understand the material. I got an A in this coures... though not too good, but ok.
 his questions are tricky but u can make it out with more thinking...
 good luck everybody
Nice prof. Be sure to read the question word by word and beware of part C. Use backward logic to do multiple choice questions
Scary Prof.  Scary material. run run as fast as you can away!!

Amazing class.  Will help you throughout your SFU career.  Even though i ended up with a crappy mark, it more than makes up for whatever i learned in that class!  I recommend EVERBODY to take this course!
If you do not need this course, DON'T TAKE IT WITH HIM.

I took this course a couple of sem. ago. I found it really interesting and useful.... tricky, yes... impossible to pass..no. Just review past exams and get really familiarized with the material, then you're fine.
Good prof...
this class was the reason i am no longer in SFU..crapy prof..crapy ta..and some stupid logics..if u get it u get it if u dont, u never will..

This insane class was math, but with words! The course started off fairly easily but then suddenly lost everyone. There was a crucial bridge of information that was missing. A class failure rate of 30% is SCARY!! Don't take this class!!
a very nice and funny prof. but he is very very very tricky....
very nice prof,and very useful course.he told me how to use my brain efficiently.To the exam,once u get use to the Thinking pattern,you can pass it
No Comments

need lots of past exam in order to get familiar with his tricky questions....~  Notes are exactly the same every semester.. written part on the exam is way way easier than the MC~  Not an easy course!

Pompous Twit. Doesn't seem to know his stuff as well as a lot of other philosophy profs at SFU. Phil001 is a pretty ridiculous course anyway. It's mostly common sense and basic logic. A bit of a waste of time, I dropped it pretty quick. An Easy 'A' though
midterms and final r so tricky...this course is so hard~~
Exceptionally hard exams with NO preparation.  Will not even go over past exam questions...Hardest course i have taken.
I did my best and just got B only.
Great prof! Tough class.
His exams ARE tricky.  However, if you do enough of his past midterms, you will see past the tricky wording in the MC and will end up okay on the midterm.

Gots a voice that belongs on the radio, not in a university. Wicked at giving lectures but mid terms are tricky dicky. If ya take this course with him as the prof, be pepare for some pretty low marks.
Very tricky...
there is not enough time to do the midterms. The midterms are too hard, he makes them so tricky by his wording. It's very hard to get over 60%.

The concepts in this course are very easy to understand however this prof's strategy to make the course hard is to use tricky wording on the exams hence the hard exams.get your hands on some of his earlier exams and see the type of wording he uses...
SO SIMPLE!
must be very very goodlooking when he was young.Excellent teacher
HARD midterms/finals... full of trick questions. you cannot get higher than 60%
He should put his lecture notes on the Web.  There's too much copying.
Excellent but hard teacher, one of the best speakers I've ever met
hard!exams suck.have to know your stuff well otherwise don't plan on doing well!
tricky exams, part c is killer, him=clear, concise course=very tricky
If you can succeed in this course, uni papers will become a breeze! Fun course.
Need to understand the concepts well to get high grade.Beware of Part C in exam!
A very clear and concise teacher!
Great speaker and very organized.
lectures are very good, part C on his exams are killer
boring lecture
Exceptionally tricky exams.  Does the Austin Powers finger to mouth thing.
great prof! love the course. midterms are tricky, but ok. glad he's gonna scale!
Love his voice, very sexy^^ But very TRICKY exams...
Didn't like his multiple choice, all else is okay.
Sounds like a radio announcer, clear prof with hard tests....section c!
excellent prof, interesting course
Ridiculously easy. Reads directly off notes posted online, no need for lectures.
Organized, clear and concise, but exams can be a bit tricky sometimes
FINAL IS TRICKIER THAN MIDTERMS
He is my favorite prof~!
ruined me for the entire semester! lots of failures in his class!
Excelent teacher, whiners should study more,,,
Whiners, he was a good prof, and the course was stupidly easy.
This class was dead easy, and he was a great lecturer. Very clear and concise.
This final was so easy.  Got 50% on the midterms tho.  Boring, and tricky
Krazy guy! soooo boring and yet so tricky on tha exams..
Tricky exam,have to pay attention to question otherwise.FAIL! Warn! don't cheat!
though i got A, i still dislike him. clear but cocky and tricky exam
Tricky indeed, yet lectures helpful if you copy fast enough
horrible! tricky exams, low marks, boring classes, his voice makes you sleep!
very clear, I got an A - don't know y everyone's bashing his exams
Good lecturer, an ass in person. Beware of his exams. Harsh tries to trick you.
DO NOT TAKE HIS COURSE... while you may learn a lot, you'll fail!!!!
to-the-point useful classnotes, lotsa past exams available, no prob for an A
Great prof. Really knows what he's talking about.
Intelligent, Articulate and wise professor. After his class, I became rational.
No Comments
LOVES HIS OWN VOICE
tricky
Top notch! This Prof will leave an indelible impression
He tricks!
not easy, but tells you everything you need to know
trickest prof i've ever had
AVOID HIM
very clear & articulative
Interesting prof, but the exams are pretty disheartening.
stupid prof, silly exam question, even himself dont know the answer. and we have to collect back all the exam, since his answer keys are full of mistakes. very unfair prof,and never reply email

I can say he's a pretty good prof. I thought his midterms and final were pretty tricky, especially the MC question part. All the lecture slides are posted up in WebCT after each chapter. Tut help clear some material, depends on who your TA was. btw, Wil C is a pretty good TA. gave us a lot of info to help us do well on the midterms and final.
Great prof, has a lot of stories so your lectures wont be dead boring. And he teaches, nah, talks about not only how to be a good student academically but a good person too.
He is by far the best professor I've ever had! Love his classes
he's a very nice guy. the classes is full of fun. also, the things he teaches really changed my view of the world.

The prof is a nice enough person, but I was very disappointed with her teaching. Provides partially filled pdfs that we you can take notes on, but she does not give enough time to take notes. Hardly writes, just talks. No tutorials to speak of. I think this course is just a cashcow because of BUS students. Avoid at all costs. I am very upset!!!

Has fill in the blank notes that are extremely useful. Lectures are well organized. Philosophy itself can be pretty challenging but she is very fair. Didn't attend class often since it was early in the morning but still kept up. Recommended for an elective with short readings!
She is just not a good person or a good prof. Too full of herself. Take this course with someone else and you will love it.

Stay away from her. If you are planning to take this course with this person, consider: 1- not all phil teachers are this annoying - almost all are very nice. 2- not all phil courses are this much useless and random - most are very interesting and fun. 3- this course has as much to do with phil as it does with stats, medicine & everything else.
No Comments
No Comments
